funds  and  accounts  established  under  the  Bond  Indenture  subject  to  certain  exceptions  as  more  fully  described  herein  and  iii  all  proceeds  of  the  foregoing  including  investment  earnings thereon held by BancFirst Oklahoma City Oklahoma as trustee the Bond Trustee under the Bond Indenture dated as of  March 1 2018 the Bond

Indenture between the Board and the Bond Trustee The Bond Trustee also has been designated to act as  Paying Agent and Registrar for the Bonds In addition the Bonds are secured by amounts that become available under a Master Trust  Agreement  dated  as  of  October  1  2003  the  Master  Trust  Agreement  between  the  Board  and  BancFirst  as  trustee  the  Master  Trustee The Bonds are subject to optional redemption and extraordinary mandatory redemption prior to  maturity See THE BONDS Redemption Provisions herein The Bonds are being issued to provide funds i to make loans to Oklahoma local governmental entities to finance projects eligible  for financial assistance from the Drinking Water State Revolving Fund ii to reimburse the Board for amounts previously advanced to  make  such  loans  iii  to  finance  certain  State  Matching  Funds  that  are  required  as  a  condition  of  receiving  federal  moneys  for  the  Drinking Water State Revolving Fund Program and iv to pay costs of issuance of the Bonds Maturity Schedule on Inside Cover Page The State of Oklahoma the State is not obligated to pay the principal of or interest on the Bonds The Bonds do not  constitute  a  debt  or  a  pledge  of  the  faith  and  credit  or  taxing  power  of  the  State  or  of  any  county  municipality  or  political  subdivision of the State and the holders or owners thereof shall have no right to have taxes levied by the State Legislature or the  taxing  authority  of  any  county  municipality  or  political  subdivision  of  the  State  for  the  payment  of  the  principal  thereof  or  interest thereon The Board has no taxing power The Bonds described above are offered for sale when as and if issued and received by the Underwriters subject to prior sale to  withdrawal or modification of the offer without notice and subject to certification by the Attorney General of the State and the approval  of legality by McCall Parkhurst  Horton LLP Dallas Texas Bond Counsel SUPPLEMENT TO OFFICIAL STATEMENT DATED SEPTEMBER 10 2013    59815000 CITY OF MIRAMAR FLORIDA Special Obligation Refunding and Improvement Revenue Bonds Series 2013 This Supplement to the Official Statement dated September 10 2013 the Official Statement has been  prepared by the City of Miramar Florida the City in connection with the issuance and sale of the  abovecaptioned series of bonds the Series 2013 Bonds The first optional redemption date for the Series 2013 Bonds contained in the Official Statement  under  the  subheading  DESCRIPTION  OF  THE  SERIES  2013  BONDSOptional  Redemption  appearing on p 7 of the Official Statement is incorrectly stated as October 1 2023 rather than October 1  2022 Accordingly that subheading is hereby replaced in its entirety with the following Optional Redemption The Series 2013 Bonds maturing on or after October 1 2023 are subject to redemption in whole  or in part at any time on or after October 1 2022 in such order of maturities as may be determined by  the City less than all of a single maturity to be selected by lot at a Redemption Price equal to 100 of  the principal amount of the Series 2013 Bonds to be redeemed plus accrued interest to the date fixed for  redemption without premium This Supplement constitutes an integral part of the Official Statement and must be read in  conjunction with the Official Statement including the appendices thereto Recipients are requested  to attach this Supplement to the Official Statement Reference is made to the entire Official Statement for  information relevant to the City and the Series 2013 Bonds All capitalized terms not defined herein shall  have the same meaning as in the Official Statement Except  as  expressly  supplemented  or  amended  hereby  the  terms  of  the  offering  of  the  Series 2013 Bonds set forth in the Official Statement remain in full force and effect  Date of Supplement September 18 2013

the  Twentieth  Supplement In the Twentieth Supplement the City delegated the pricing of the Bonds and certain other matters to a Pricing Officer  who is authorized to act on behalf of the City in selling and delivering the Bonds in a Pricing Certificate  The Master Ordinance the  Twentieth  Supplement  and  the  Pricing  Certificate  are  collectively  referred  to  herein  as  the  Bond  Ordinance    The  Master  Ordinance  contains the terms for the issuance of Parity WaterWastewater Obligations and the covenants and security provisions related thereto The  City also has outstanding Prior First Lien Obligations and Prior Subordinate Lien Obligations which are secured by joint and several pledges  of the net revenues of both the Water and Wastewater System and Electric Utility System The City must comply with the covenants and  security  provisions  related  to  the  Prior  First  Lien  Obligations  and  Prior  Subordinate  Lien  Obligations  while  such  obligations  remain  outstanding The Master Ordinance prohibits the issuance of additional revenue obligations secured by joint and several pledges of the net  revenues of both the Water and Wastewater System and Electric Utility System such as Prior First Lien Obligations or Prior Subordinate Lien  Obligations

Commercial Paper Obligations having a combined pledge of Electric Utility System and Water and Wastewater System revenues  may continue to be issued on a subordinate lien basis to the Parity WaterWastewater Obligations The Bonds are special obligations of the  City payable as to both principal and interest solely from and together with the other outstanding Parity WaterWastewater Obligations  Previously Issued Prior Subordinate Lien Obligations and Previously Issued Separate Lien Obligations equally and ratably secured only by a  lien on and pledge of the Net Revenues of the Citys Water and Wastewater System subject to the prior claim and lien on the Net Revenues  of the Water and Wastewater System to the payment and security of the Outstanding Prior First Lien Obligations as provided in the Master  Ordinance and the Twentieth Supplement Additionally the Bonds and Previously Issued Parity WaterWastewater Obligations referenced  above are equally and ratably secured by a parity lien on the funds if any deposited to the credit of the Debt Service Fund excluding any  funds on deposit in the BAB Subsidy Subaccount which was established for the exclusive benefit of the owners of the Series 2010B Bonds  issued  by  the  City  and  the  Reserve  Fund  in  accordance  with  the  terms  of  the  ordinances  authorizing  the  issuance  of  Parity  WaterWastewater Obligations The Bonds do not constitute a legal or equitable pledge charge lien or encumbrance upon any property of  the City or the WaterWastewater System except with respect to the
